name: 華國媛
objective:
This course aims to illustrate the biomedical applications of photoelectric detection instruments.  This course will discuss the basic principles of optoelectronics and the knowledge of molecular biology (such as introducing the basic structure of deoxyribonucleic acid, ribonucleic acid, protein, or cell).  
Class participation is evaluated by in-class discussion on the assignments. Students must complete pre-class and after-class assignments.
schedule:
Course Schedule:
Week 1: Introduction
Week 2: The Application and Future of Bio-optoelectronics
Week 3: Molecular biology & Bio-optoelectronics - DNA, RNA 
Week 4: Molecular biology & Bio-optoelectronics - Protein
Week 5: Bio-optoelectronics and Signaling
Week 6: Bio-optoelectronics and Advanced Materials-1
Week 7: Bio-optoelectronics and Advanced Materials- 2
Week 8: Research papers review
Week 9: Middle exam
Week 10: BioPhotonics Detecting System-1
Week 11: BioPhotonics Detecting System-2
Week 12: Light-harvesting complex- phycobiliproteins
Week 13: Bio-inspired sensors
Week 14: Bioluminescence
Week 15: Quantum Dots
Week 16: Applications of light in the biomedical industry
Week 17: Research paper review
Week 18: Final Report
scorePolicy:
